DOC.brief_summary: A trial of combination of two drugs for the treatment of refractory lupus nephritis.
DOC.brief_title: Low-dose Combination of Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) and Tacrolimus (Tac) for Refractory Lupus Nephritis
DOC.detailed_description: Low-dose combination of mycophenolate mofetil and tacrolimus for refractory lupus nephritis: a 12-month prospective study
DOC.criteria: 1. Active nephritis documented by renal biopsy within 24 months of entry; 2. Failure to respond to 2 or more immunosuppressive regimens which consisted of highdose prednisolone combined with other noncorticosteroid immunosuppressive agents together with ACE inhibitors plus or minus angiotensin receptor blockers (ARB) for at least 4 months for each regimen at the maximally tolerated drug dosages; 3. Serum creatinine (Scr) less than 200umol/L. 1. Previous intolerance to either MMF/Tac; 2. Scr >200umol/L; 3. Informed consent unavailable.
